title: Could Trump tariffs hurt US more than EU? Top European banker thinks so
shortDescription: The administration has already announced tariffs on steel and aluminium, and Trump has threatened 200% tariffs on EU wine and spirits.

title: Efforts to challenge Trump's actions intensify
shortDescription: Nationwide, there were more than 2,000 protests in February, more than twice as many as the same month of the first Trump administration.

title: It's Barron Trump's birthday: The 'King of the internet' turns 19
shortDescription: Unlike the usual Trump family practice of maximalist exposure, Barron Trump has flown under the radar for most of his life.

title: Justice Roberts' rebuke marks growing Trump showdown with courts
shortDescription: Chief Justice John Roberts' rebuke of President Donald Trump's call to impeach a judge marks a growing showdown between Trump and the courts.

title: Trump to sign order Thursday aimed at closing Education Department
shortDescription: Exclusive: President Donald Trump plans to sign an executive order Thursday seeking to eliminate the U.S. Department of Education.

title: Trump admin cuts project tracking stolen Ukrainian kids
shortDescription: The Yale University research lab was tracking thousands of Ukrainian children forcibly deported to Russia since the invasion began.

title: 'New leadership as we move forward': Democrats rail against Schumer
shortDescription: Chuck Schumer continues to face backlash from some members of his party after he voted in favor of a spending bill that averted a government shutdown.

title: Amtrak CEO abruptly steps down, citing new Trump administration
shortDescription: Amtrak CEO Stephen Gardner said Wednesday he's stepping down immediately after more than four years as head of the U.S. passenger railroad.

title: Institute of Peace sues Trump, DOGE: How the conflict unfolded
shortDescription: Trump and Musk ordered the institute to reduce its size, as part of DOGE's efforts. The issue, USIP says, is their employees aren't federal workers.

title: Trump administration sued for 'breaking the student loan system'
shortDescription: American Federation of Teachers is suing the U.S. Department of Education for allegedly denying borrowers access to affordable loan payments.

title: Judge denies Trump bid to toss Columbia student's challenge to arrest
shortDescription: A U.S. judge rejected the Trump administration's bid to dismiss detained student Mahmoud Khalil's challenge to the legality of his immigration arrest.

title: In Trump call, Zelenskyy OKs limited ceasefire. What's off the table?
shortDescription: President Donald Trump and Ukrainian leader Volodymyr Zelenskyy are speaking for the first time since a televised Oval Office blowup last month.

title: Chief Justice rebukes Trump after he calls for US judge's impeachment
shortDescription: Plus: Trump administration withholds details from a judge about deportation flights for Venezuelans. | These and more stories on The Excerpt.

title: Tim Walz says Democrats must 'push as far as we can' against Trump
shortDescription: Former Democratic vice presidential nominee Tim Walz held a town-hall style event in Republican Derrick Van Orden's Wisconsin district.
